TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . He is represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .

From DATE to CARDINAL DATE the applicant worked as DATE manager of a limited liability company owned by him - a petrol station and a car wash - named PERSON og LOC . The company operated under a sales distribution agreement with ORG The applicant spent most of TIME in the car wash , where he embezzled cash payments received from customers , which over DATE added up to MONEY ( ORG ) . He kept these monies inter alia in his mother ’s bank box and safe .

On DATE ORG ( byrett ) convicted the applicant of embezzlement ( Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Penal Code ( straffeloven ) ) , fraud of ORG CARDINAL vis - à - vis Shell ( Article CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) , and also false accounting ( Article CARDINAL of LAW and LAW regnskapsloven ) ) , evasion of value added tax ( section DATE of LAW DATE ( merverdiavgiftsloven ) and Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW ) and , in his capacity as DATE manager and chairman of the board of the limited liability company LOC og CARDINAL of tax evasion to the benefit of the company ( sections CARDINAL - CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW DATE ( ligningsloven ) ) in respect of the embezzled amounts . He was sentenced to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment and prohibited from engaging in independent private business activities for DATE . ORG further ordered the seizure of ORG CARDINAL .

In DATE ORG ( likningsnemnda ) imposed on the applicant in his personal capacity a tax surcharge of PERCENT concerning DATE . Under the relevant provision the surcharge should normally have amounted to PERCENT but , in the event of intent or gross negligence , the rate was PERCENT . In DATE the applicant appealed against this decision to ORG ( overlikningsnemda ) .

Concurrently with the above , the applicant appealed against ORG judgment but ORG ( lagmannsrett ) refused him leave to appeal , as did ORG of ORG ( Høyesteretts kjæremålsutvalg ) , the latter on DATE . Subsequently , on DATE ORG accepted a request by the applicant to amend its earlier decision and gave him leave to appeal against his sentence and the loss of his business rights , but maintained its earlier refusal of leave to appeal in respect of the assessment of evidence in relation to the question of guilt .

On DATE , after holding an oral hearing during which the applicant and CARDINAL witnesses gave evidence , ORG modified the sentence to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment DATE spent in pre - trial detention ) . ORG noted the tax surcharge imposed in DATE and also observed that the applicant had appealed against that decision and that the appeal had not yet been decided . It stated that it would proceed on the assumption that the applicant would be required to pay tax surcharges , but not in such a way as to infringe the prohibition of double jeopardy .

In this connection ORG had regard to a ruling of DATE in which ORG dismissed a case brought by prosecuting authorities and found that criminal punishment after the imposition of tax surcharges at PERCENT constituted double jeopardy in breach of LAW No . CARDINAL to the LAW . Subsequently , however , on DATE , ORG of ORG , on an appeal by the prosecution , quashed ORG dismissal of the aforementioned case , finding that that ORG had based its decision on an erroneous interpretation of the law . In its view , the said ORG provision did not prevent criminal punishment after the imposition of a tax surcharge .
On DATE the applicant sought leave to appeal against ORG judgment of DATE , but on DATE ORG of ORG refused him leave to appeal ( a decision notified to him on DATE ) .

In the meantime , on DATE ORG had reduced the tax surcharge from PERCENT in order to avoid any conflict with LAW No . CARDINAL to the LAW . In this connection it was noted that the applicant ’s prosecution and conviction under sections CARDINAL - CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW related to advantages secured for PERSON og LOC . The applicant had not , however , been charged or convicted with regard to the submission of incorrect and incomplete information to the tax authorities that might result in tax advantages for him personally , though in terms of the advantages that the applicant had ultimately hoped to achieve by his conduct there was a close relationship between the company ’s and his own tax evasion . ORG noted that a shareholder who incurred liability to pay a tax surcharge on behalf of a company could seek repayment from the company ( section CARDINAL sub - section , of LAW ( skatteloven ) ) . It further had regard to a plenary decision of DATE in which ORG ruled that a PERCENT tax surcharge would constitute a criminal charge for the purposes of LAW but that there were reasons for assuming that this provision did not apply to a surcharge of PERCENT .

On DATE ORG changed its jurisprudence in this area , in CARDINAL plenary decisions . In CARDINAL of these it concluded that a criminal case should be dismissed if the accused had already been subjected to tax surcharges of PERCENT , or else there would be a violation of LAW No . CARDINAL . Regard was had to the earlier ruling of DATE , in which it was concluded that a PERCENT tax surcharge constituted a “ criminal charge ” within the meaning of LAW . The third case concerned only LAW , where ORG found that the imposition of a PERCENT tax surcharge constituted a “ criminal charge ” for the purposes of that provision .

On DATE , following the above change of jurisprudence of ORG , the applicant asked ORG to proceed with its examination of a request he had previously made in DATE for the reopening of the criminal proceedings against him . He further demanded that ORG reverse its DATE decision and reimburse him the tax surcharges which he had paid .
No decision has yet been given on either of the above requests .
On DATE the applicant started serving his sentence . All of his repeated applications for release after serving CARDINAL of the sentence have been refused .

On DATE ORG , sitting in plenary , rejected an application for the reopening of proceedings relating to tax surcharges , lodged by another person in a separate case . ORG concluded that there was no justification for it to apply retroactively its jurisprudence of DATE to that case .
